module.title: tòrr
module.p: tòrr large quantity is a masculine generic quantity noun, a semantic extension of the common noun tòrr heap, mound.
In terms of the stuff being quantified, tòrr generally works like other generic quantity nouns –

ul.li:
When the stuff being quantified is new information, it is usually expressed as a noun modifier/specifier of the generic quantity noun, either the genitive singular of a mass noun or the genitive plural of a count noun –
Dh’òl Raonaid tòrr fìona. Rachel drank a lot of wine.
Tha tòrr chon aig Màiri. Mary has a lot of dogs.
tòrr airgid
a heap of money td. 382
Tha tòrr dhaoine den bheachd sin.
Lots of people are of that opinion. td. 382
Tha tòrr dhiofaran ann.
There are many differences. td. 594

When the stuff being quantified is already known, it is usually introduced by the partitive preposition de of governing a specified (i.e. ‘definite’) noun
Dh’òl Raonaid tòrr den fhìona. Rachel drank a lot of the wine.
Cheannaich Màiri tòrr de mo choin. Mary bought a lot of my dogs.

When the stuff being quantified is already known, and has just been referred to, or can be inferred, tòrr can occur on its own –
Dh’òl Raonaid tòrr. Rachel drank a lot.
Tha tòrr aig Màiri. Mary has a lot.
td. 39

Alternatively, tòrr can be followed by one of the de prepositional pronouns –
Dh’òl Raonaid tòrr dheth. Rachel drank a lot of it.
Tha tòrr dhiubh aig Màiri. Mary has a lot of them.
td. 39

tòrr mu (dheidhinn) a lot of [information/knowledge] about some topic –
Tha Màiri ag iarraidh cluinntinn tòrr mu choin. Mary wants to hear a lot about dogs.
td. 60

tòrr ri (dhèanamh) a lot to do –
Tha tòrr ri dhèanamh aig Raonaid. Rachel has a lot to do.
Tha tòrr ri dèanamh – gidheadh, soirbichidh leinn.
There is a lot to be done – nonetheless, we will manage. td. 387

module.p:
tòrr can also be used to modify a comparative adjective –
Tha Seumas tòrr nas beairtiche na tha Dòmhnall. James is much richer than Donald [is].
Bha e tòrr na b’inntinniche na càch.
He was much more interesting than the others. td. ??

tòrr can be emphasised by mòr.
tòrr mòrr
td. ??
